titleStmt.title: A hundred godly lessons. That a mother on her death-bed gave to her children, whereby they may know how to guide themselves towards God and man, to the benefit of the common-wealth, joy of their parents, and good of themselves. Tune is, Wigmores galliard.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clarke.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
